page.title: 13Mr.Amey Talking About Pitsea
page.content:
Mr Amey is Chairman of our school's Governors. He has lived in Pitsea for nearly 40 years and he came into school to tell us about the changes in Pitsea over the years. He told us that the roads used to be all muddy and narrow and he thought the roads and paths today were better. He also told us about the houses. People built tiny homes and used to use them for weekends. Then they built extensions on them so they could invite relatives over.Mr Amey thought the houses now were better. Bakers and Grocers vans used to go round selling. There was a house and the people turned the living room into a shop. He thought the shops were better now as there was more choice.
Pitsea Junior School Group.
